intro: Hieracium orcadense, commonly known as Orkney hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the British Isles. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium orcadense is known for its ornamental value and is often found in gardens and naturalized areas.
